page.title: 15Church
page.content: The present church of Stenness dates from 1906. The oldest gravestone in the churchyard dates from the 17th. century. The old name of the church is the church of the Holy Cross and the possibility that a holy cross stood here is real for not far to the west is the site of the pagan Stone of Odin beside the Stones of Stenness.The church has recently been restored, a new outside toilet built and car-park made; a new graveyard lies to the south-east. The minister of the church, Rev. Williams has just retired after 40 years service and the new minister is Rev. Thomas Clark. The parishes of Orphir to the south and Stenness are joined together under one ministry. The church continues to play a very active part in the parish of Stenness.
